sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Nuclear disaster narrowly avoided at Zaporizhia, with plans of evacuations throughout eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Preparations for the new school year are underway in the Donetsk region, with a new Russian-approved curriculum in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: NATO Security General has called for an increase in the alliance's presence and investment in the Arctic, as Russia reopens hundreds of military sites in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Hungary gives the green light to start the construction of two new nuclear reactors by Rosatom, Russia's state nuclear agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Iodine tablets have reportedly been supplied to residents near the Zaporizhia power plant,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: amid very real fears that fighting around the complex could lead to a nuclear catastrophe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The precautionary measure follows a temporary disconnect to Europe's largest power plant from Ukraine's national grid on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Kyiv says it has now partly reconnected the plant to the national system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy underlined that the situation remains very risky and dangerous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Any further disconnections of the plant from the grid or actions by Russia that could trigger the shutdown of the reactors will again put the plant one step away from disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: away from disaster. Ukraine's deputy prime minister Irina Vereshchuk has announced plans to expand mandatory evacuations for civilians living on the war's front lines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Speaking on national television, Vereshchuk said evacuating women with children and elderly people would be a priority for some districts of the Eastern Kharkiv region and the Southern Zaporizhzhia and Mykolaiv regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere, Ukrainian forces have struck an important bridge by Russian occupying forces in the southern Kursan region, serving a blow to Moscow's offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the suburban town of Bucha, outside of Kyiv, scars of war are everywhere you look.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For Belarusians living in Ukraine, aftermath of war brings a unique feeling of horror, caught between the crossfires in a war they didn't ask for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Political refugee Karina Patsyumkina arrived in Ukraine just two weeks before Russia's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She says we know there are Belarusians who are fighting on the side of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There are volunteers who have nowhere to go because they are Belarusians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: When I see my blue Belarusian passport, I want to burn it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Belarusians are people without a country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nobody needs them. It turns out that you are asking for protection from the country which is at war. It turns out you are safer in the country that is at war rather than in Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For Russians in Ukraine, the feelings are similar, with many voicing support for their host country. Andrei Sidorkin, who has lived in Ukraine for 17 years, returning to his homeland is no option.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He says returning to Russia is out of the question.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There I will most likely get 15 to 20 years in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I'm not sure about that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the probability is very high high given the scale of repression there now." Sudorkin was not accepted to the Ukrainian army, but did make Molotov cocktails and help evacuate artwork from museums in Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Schools and teachers in the Russian-controlled Donetsk region are preparing for the new school year under a Russian curriculum and with Russian textbooks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The prime minister of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic, Vitaly Kotsenko, assures all grades will be supplied with the mandatory materials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We will fully supply our schools of the Donetsk People's Republic, all grades from first to eleventh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have history, Russian literature, geography.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We hope that the children will study proper literature and acquire proper knowledge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Larisa Volodyuk is a librarian at a school in Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Going through the books she has received, she highlights that there is not a single Ukrainian book left in the school or storage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She also believes that the Russian books are much better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She says that the materials they have received are brand new editions from 2022 and that the literature list has been completely renewed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Mariupol, many schools have been severely damaged by shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While reconstruction is in full swing, many will not be ready for the new school year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Another urgent problem is the lack of teachers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, the authorities of the self-proclaimed Republic of Donetsk claim that there are many volunteers willing to come from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO Security General Jens Stoltenberg called for an increase in the alliance's security in the Arctic, as Russia is growing its military presence in the region by reopening military sites.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And he warned that the shortest path for Moscow's missiles to reach North America would be through the North Pole.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Russia has set up a new Arctic command.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It has opened hundreds of new and former Soviet-era Arctic military sites, including airfields and deep water ports. Russia is also using the region as a testbed for many of its new novel weapon systems. Stoltenberg also noted that after Finland and Sweden joins the group, seven of the eight Arctic countries will be NATO members, excluding only Russia. Canada had previously been cautious about NATO's presence in the Arctic region, but its prime minister claims that the war in Ukraine has changed the situation. It is important that we all recognize the shifting geopolitical realities that the world is now facing and across the NATO alliance countries are investing more in ability to secure NATO territory including across the Arctic. Stoltenberg also expressed concerns about Beijing's growing interest in the Arctic it plans to build the world's largest icebreaker fleet Russian state-owned company Rosatom is set to begin the construction of two new nuclear reactors at the Hungarian Pax power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The expansion plan stems from a 2014 deal between the two countries, which will see the plant's nuclear capacity more than double.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The expansion project is set to be carried out with a Russian loan and will cost some 12.5 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Hungarian foreign minister celebrated the beginning of the works.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Hungarian Foreign Minister celebrated the beginning of the works. It is now clearer than ever that the countries that have nuclear energy and nuclear power plants can feel more secure in terms of their energy supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The greater the nuclear energy capacity of a country, the safer it will be in the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While the EU bloc has sanctioned Russia economically for its war in Ukraine and is moving away from Russian gas and oil, current restrictions do not include the Russian nuclear industry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Hungary has not unconditionally supported the European decisions and aims to secure the country's future energy supplies with this expansion in light of the current energy crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The clear favourite to become Britain's next Prime Minister asked a quick-fire question about the French President.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: President Macron, friend or foe? The jury's out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Loudly applauded by Conservative Party members.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: If I become Prime Minister, I'll judge him on deeds, not words.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But what does this really say?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Are Britain and France once again foes?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Here in the Conservative Party's heartland, the home counties in southern England, the vast majority of Conservatives voted for Brexit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And in a town like Royal Tunbridge Wells, many see France as the villain in their post-Brexit reality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I think the French do what the French want to do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And you think Liz Truss is right to say that Emmanuel Macron's not a friend?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yes, I think perhaps, yes, he's right, yeah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: She's probably right, because I've been reading the press over the last few months and years, I can't see he's really a good friend, especially over Brexit. He had a real go at us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He has to do the best for his country and we have to do the best for ours. Simple as that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Is it right for the potential future Prime Minister to say that though?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I don't see why not. She has an opinion. Liz Truss was undoubtedly playing to the gallery of Conservative Party members. But is this rhetoric likely to cause further damage between the UK, the EU and France? It's not a very wise statement, I think, to say of your nearest neighbours that you're not actually sure whether they're run by a friend or a foe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We all know it isn't really meant, and I think that makes it even harder.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There's a certain sense of British jokiness underneath it as well, and it makes it really hard to unravel that and the politics and the international relations, and it just feels like we're even more stuck because of that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Many Europeans will have been wondering whether the next Prime Minister would take a different approach to Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: While the jury is still out, Liz Truss has already begun nailing her colours to the mast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, London.
